intro: Martinezia nobilis, commonly known as the noble martinezia, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Cactaceae, which includes cacti and related succulent plants. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It is adapted to arid environments, with thick, fleshy stems that store water. Martinezia nobilis is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in full sun conditions.
